COMMENT_TX: $Roy Halladay throws a no-hitter in his first post-season game; it is the second no-hitter in post-season history, following the perfect game by Don Larsen in the 1956 World Series
$the only runner of the game for the Reds
Reds shortstop Orlando Cabrera left the game due to an injured side

replay,5,utlec001,PHI,hirsj901,CIN09,I,N,I,,H $Reds CF Drew Stubbs leaped and reached over the wall in an attempt to catch the ball; numerous fans also tried to catch the ball and Stubbs had no chance because of the fans; the Reds asked about the play so crew chief John Hirschbeck watched the replay and upheld the call of no fan interference since the ball was clearly over the wall when it was touched; this was the second use of replay in post-season
